meanings.definition: To break down or decompose naturally through the action of living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The fallen leaves in the forest slowly biodegraded into rich soil.
meanings.sent2: The apple biodegraded in the compost bin, returning nutrients to the earth.
meanings.sent3: The curious raccoon watched as the banana peel biodegraded into nothing but a memory.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to biodegrade the old memories, turning them into fragments of the past.
meanings.sent5: The sun and rain worked together to biodegrade the fallen tree, transforming it into a part of the forest floor.

meanings.definition: Having undergone the process of breaking down or decomposing naturally through the action of living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The biodegraded leaves provided essential nutrients for the growing plants.
meanings.sent2: The biodegraded paper bag was now unrecognizable, blending back into the environment.
meanings.sent3: The biodegraded fruit peel became a playground for tiny insects, a miniature world of decay.
meanings.sent4: The biodegraded wood had a unique texture, a result of its natural transformation.
meanings.sent5: The biodegraded plastic bottle served as a reminder of the impact of human waste on the planet.
